comment: There were no tests or quizzes for this class. Ward was very helpful when it came to assignments. She was very understanding with field placements, but needs to learn to make better use of class time. The workload was kind of heavy, but it was not very difficult.
This class was not as heavy as other classes in block 1. The class sometimes felt really slow but Ward is super understanding and a great professor. She was very flexible.

Dr. Ward is a very nice person and understanding, however I did not like her as a professor. Class always felt like a waste of time and it felt like she always purposefully dragged it out the full three hours when it was not necessary at all. What we did in class could easily be done in an hour, and it was all group/busy work that was pointless.
I LOVE PROF WARD!! Take her! she is awesome assignments were beneficial to my future class and you are able to fix any grade.

I would take Professor Ward again. We have no exams or quizzes in class. We just have readings and assignments. She lets you do the assignments as many times as needed to get the grade you want. She is also very sweet and caring. She also works with you if needed!

Really sweet and caring. Loved her as a person. However, be prepared to learn more about how to use math to teach social justice than about how to teach math. Not allowed to use gradual release of responsibility in your lesson plan. Easy grader, good feedback, sweet person, but I disagree with her teaching philosophy.

Dr.Ward is a great professor. She gives excellent feedback that actually helps you learn and understand your assignments more. She is very understanding and willing to wok with you on whatever you need. She does take a bit too long to grade things but it hasn't been a huge problem. Class is fun and not stressful if you stay on top of your work.

She is extremely understanding and helpful. She asks every class how we are doing and how she can help. There is not many assignments, but they take a lot of work and time, and sometimes time is given in class. However, she cares more about the quality than the due dates. Make sure you follow the rubrics and let her know if you need help.

I LOVE JENNIFER! She is so understanding and never overwhelms us with work. She only grades your work as a completion grade and conferences with you at the end of the semester to reflect on the course and have you decide what grade you deserve. She is super sweet, caring, and cares so much about students and their health! So glad I took her!!

I won't take long to sing this professor's praises (because everyone else on here already has). But Professor Ward is an incredibly kind and flexible teacher who is willing to help you succeed I would definitely take her again.

DOES NOT BELIEVE IN GRADES. You do the work for completion credit (not a grade, just for her own personal reference for the end of the semester). Then, at the end of the semester, you tell her what grade you deserve. Very easy class and super caring professor. TAKE HER!!
